body_html:
1- In your logs, I do not see you installing the pip package you just built using pip install
2- You also enabled "OpenCL" we have not tested the configuration where both opencl and cuda are enabled. It is quite possible they are interacting in an unexpected way.
3- Also, what is the reason for not using the GPU pip packages we provide?

Also, I think the tail of your log is missing, it might contain more information.
body_text:
1- In your logs, I do not see you installing the pip package you just built using pip install
2- You also enabled "OpenCL" we have not tested the configuration where both opencl and cuda are enabled. It is quite possible they are interacting in an unexpected way.
3- Also, what is the reason for not using the GPU pip packages we provide?
Also, I think the tail of your log is missing, it might contain more information.
body:
1- In your logs, I do not see you installing the pip package you just built using `pip install`
2- You also enabled "OpenCL" we have not tested the configuration where both opencl and cuda are enabled. It is quite possible they are interacting in an unexpected way.
3- Also, what is the reason for not using the GPU pip packages we provide?

Also, I think the tail of your log is missing, it might contain more information.
